pr_title: Ensure quarkusBuild Gradle task works properly with fast-jar

timeline.bodyText: It's not a problem if only one of the two is created when running the goal?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I had the same question myself, so I ran multiple tests and didn't see any problem.
Of course this will need to vetted by our Gradle experts :)
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: Actually I had the same thought too, there are tests checking, if this is ok, we could also declare the native build result.
replies.author: glefloch

replies.bodyText: @glefloch yeah, that's a good idea for a follow up
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
Oh this should be @OutputDirectory then.
And reading the documentation, it should works as expected:
This will cause the task to be considered out-of-date when the directory path or task output to that directory has been modified since the task was last run.

Missing directory should not be a problem.
replies.author: glefloch

replies.bodyText: Oh nice, I didn't know of that annotation
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message:
Ensure quarkusBuild Gradle task works properly with fast-jar

When building a fast-jar, the typical runner jar is not created
so we need to make Gradle aware of this new output

Fixes: #11157

timeline.bodyText: Sorry my ignorance, but isn't a `·jar' extension missing here?
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: This is just the directory where all the fast-jar output goes
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
This should be @OutputDirectory then.
BTW, reading the documentation, a missing directory should not be a problem.
replies.author: glefloch
